comment._content:
Dave Cowan: So glad you appreciate the photos by Einar Erici ! We're happy to share them on The Commons with you and all others. :)
/Anna B.

comment.author: 21147115@N04
comment._content: I've just been to see an August Sander exhibition in Edinburgh. This might be a little controversial, but I think these pictures are better than his. I suppose the big difference is that Sander's have this terrible weight of history hanging over them. When you look at pictures of German people in the 1920s and 30s, you wonder what on earth happened to them.  The Sweidsh pictures don't have that sadness about them. And technically, they're magnificent.

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content: Dave Cowan: That's an interesting comparison - and conclusion! Very flattering to Einar Erici, who wasn't a professional photographer as world-famous August Sander. (But nevertheless a very good photgrapher!) Here some photos by August Sander from MoMA's Collection, as well as a text about him: www.moma.org/collection/browse_results.php?artistFilterIn... /Anna B.
